Fields.DialogueText: Hey, Volta - what do you have there?
Ah, this? Basali Basaya - my dagger. My prized possession, hee.
Oh. Well. Maybe I should stand... a little further over here...
What's wrong, Capitaine?

Fields.MenuText: The way you're eyeing it. I mean... it's beautiful, but I just want to exercise caution... over here... by this turret.
I haven't seen anything like it... the slight curve of it is something else.
Oh nothing, nothing's wrong. I'm just wondering why in the hell a Belle would need something like that.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! Come over here, Capitaine. Trust me, you have my devotion. I'll show you how to use it.
You see the way the edge catches the light? It's like it's alive.
Now, now. Don't judge a girl by her favorite weapon.
It's an interesting piece. Where'd you get it?
I haggled the hell out of a merchant and made him give it to me for less than a song. Can you believe that?
Really?
Bien sûr, Capitaine.
Hm... remind me to bring you around the market next time we dock.
@BATTLE
Aha! Hahahahaha... yes.
Uhm...
Hello there, Capitaine.
Volta? Wait, weren't you just... well, that was quick, I... I could've sworn I heard you down in the mess hall...
Oh, I was there, Capitaine. But that battle got me riled up. I just had to come out on deck for some fresh air.

Fields.MenuText: The crew does seem to appreciate your enthusiasm, Volta.
That laugh of yours sure does carry...
Would you stop bouncing? Maybe for just a moment?

Fields.DialogueText: Merci, Capitaine. Glad to hear it. And don't worry, that enthusiasm won't dissipate anytime soon.
Hmm. I'm just going to take that as a compliment, Capitaine.
Oh, all right. If you insist.
I just wanted to find you and say that you did an excellent job in that last battle. You certainly saved the hides of every person on this ship.
Oh, Capitaine. That's nice of you to say. Now, I have some work to do - I'll be in my quarters if anyone needs me.
Roger that. Always good to stay one step ahead of the enemy. Inform me if anything interesting comes up.
Oui, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
Captain, the crew is dying to test out that new tech.
You think they're ready for it, Kim?
Yes, I do.
All right, I'll check into it. You're dismissed - back to work.
Aye aye!
Volta. What... what's that smell? It smells... good.
Freshly roasted red snapper. Caught by yours truly, of course.

Fields.MenuText: I'm really hoping that you didn't come here just to dangle that plate in my face...
Wait, wait... you fish?
Red snapper... oohh, that's exactly what my stomach is calling for.

Fields.DialogueText: I would never be so cruel, Cap! Here, this plate is for you.
Bien sûr! It does the soul good to catch one's own food.
Today's your lucky day, then. I even brought a few side dishes for you.
This is amazing, Volta. Don't let the cooks see, though. I don't want them getting jealous.
Oh? ... Do you not like the food that's served in the kitchen, Capitaine?
I... what? No. No, that's not what I meant.
*ALARM*
Hmm... orders, Capitaine?
Dammit. Get to your station. This red snapper will have to wait.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Elles sont presque là, Capitaine!
We're ready for them!
@BATTLE
Oui, you'd better run, Morganas! Next time you'll think twice before going toe to toe with me!
You certainly know how to make an impression, Volta.
It's important to do so. If those Morganas decide I'm not worth the effort, maybe they'll tell as much to their Morgana friends, and they'll all leave us alone.
Hmm. It was nice having support ships nearby, in case we needed assistance. Let's radio our thanks for aiding us in that fight.
On it, Capitaine.

Fields.MenuText: Make sure they're able to make way before we move out. And after that, I'd like to hear how your research has been going.
We should escort the support ships out of the channel before we continue. Also, I'd like to hear about that research you've been doing.
All right, let's turn northwest and get a move on. Also, I'd like a rundown of that research you've been doing.

Fields.DialogueText: Which... research in particular? There's the radar, the guns, some type of latitude and longitude reader...
Which research are you referring to, Capitaine? I do a lot of research.
Oui. Right when you remind me... what research you're talking about. I do a lot.
Why don't we cover it all? Just go through it, one point at a time.
That seems like it would take... a while.
Start with new defense possibilities. What's your report?
Defense? Okay, I can do that.
One potential new system has a prototype fire control system. Deadly accurate.
But that's not all. We could attack from further distances with a more accurate system.
Which system, by the way, would benefit greatly from upgraded sonar and radar systems...
Volta! Volta, take a breath. That's a lot of research you've been doing.
Ha! Yes, you're correct. Of course, I haven't done it all on my own - some of the crew has assisted me with my research.
Keep up the good work. I'm sure these new systems will be of great use to us, one day.
Merci, Captaine.
Chop the vegetables precisely at this angle, everyone. Hold your wrist in order to roll as you chop. Watch closely now.
The way you wave that knife around as you're speaking is a little disconcerting, Volta...
... I'm sorry, what was that?
Disconcerting. You. Waving the knife.
Ahh, yes... Seaman Bauldun. Would you like to show off your knife skills, then? Come, I'll let you take over, if you wish.
That really isn't necessary, Volta.
Thought so.
Am I interrupting something here?
Hello, Capitaine. Just training a few of the crew members up into regular culinarians.

Fields.MenuText: I don't recognize all the faces I'm seeing here.
This doesn't look like any cooking class I've ever seen.
I think most people can figure out how to chop vegetables on their own, Volta.

Fields.DialogueText: And for good reason. Word's gotten around to the other Belles of my proficiency in the kitchen, and they've sent their cooks here to learn a thing or two.
Well, my methods aren't exactly orthodox.
You might be surprised, Capitaine.
Hmm... duly noted. Mind if I sit in on one of these lessons?
Ha! If you think that your rank will make me go easy on you, think again.
I think I'm up to the challenge.
*ALARM*
Morganas are approaching from the north, Capitaine. Bauldun, everyone else, get to your stations.
But what about the...
Now, please.
You heard her, let's move.
@BATTLE
Hmm...
What are you doing with these coordinates?
I'm just thinking about the maneuvers Great Britain has used recently during battle...

Fields.MenuText: What about them? According to the latest reports, they've been winning their battles. Shouldn't that be a good thing?
Oh? Are you studying up on strategies?
Perfect. I've been meaning to ask them about their flanking strategies. Are their maneuvers proving to be of use to you?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, of course. But... they're doing a little too well, I say. I'm just going keep an eye on things here and there.
Sure, let's say that. Just making sure we have eyes everywhere, both on the Morganas and humans alike.
Hee, they are, Capitaine. Do you remember when Rome defeated Hannibal by using his own strategy against him? Same plan. Different time.
The enemy of my enemy, Volta. The Protection Force stands strong and I believe in it. If we're going to win this war, we need to all work together.
Of course, Capitaine... I understand. I will go ahead and contact the Brits about their flanking maneuvers... maybe even ask for more herbs while I'm at it.
Good. We'll talk more about this later.
Bien sûr. Don't misunderstand, I'm not thoroughly anti-British. I love British fashion. I borrowed a magazine from a crewmate. Peplums are out, and waist-cinched tops are in. In. IN.
... I guess that's a start.
@BATTLE
... We're on our way, Ma'am. Out.
Capitaine? Who was on the radio?
That was our friendly frigate captain, Riley. We need to head toward the Mediterranean, and fast. We've picked up heavy Morgana activity in that area.
Understood. We'll likely face a lot of enemies along the way.

Fields.MenuText: Undeniably so. I'm going to up the inspections for the time being. I'll be damned if we're blindsided by a loose bolt.
I'm scheduling more weapons training for the crew. We need everyone on this ship to be prepared.
Exactly. You and I need to discuss tactics and prepare for whatever we can think of.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll have Kennedy write up schedules and rotations. No need to worry, Cap.
I'll have Gunnery Wheeler lead the exercises. I may just help with the class myself... hee.
D'accord. Over a game of chess? If you don't mind me outsmarting you, that is.
We'll both draft up authorizations. Make sure...
Capitaine! Morganas up ahead.
Volta. Our weapons are in tip-top shape following that last inspection, right?
Oui. Bien sûr.
Perfect... let's show them how it's done. Officer Kim! Front and center.
Orders, Captain?
Get the crew ready for battle.
I'm pretty sure they're already there.
@BATTLE
... e ele caiu.
Did he? HA!
Ahh, I'm laughing so hard my eyes are watering.

Fields.MenuText: Ha... ha... yeah, that was great. A real knee slapper.
Come again?
What's this all about? You two are chattering at a mile a minute.

Fields.DialogueText: My apologies, Capitaine. You caught the tail end of a classic joke. It's terrible in English.
Just an inside joke, Capitaine. Maybe I should teach you some Portuguese, yes?
I haven't laughed this hard in some time.
I'm sorry, Captain. I haven't spoken in Portuguese for some time, now. It reminds me of home.
Seaman Bauldun... this is your first year at sea, correct?
Yes, Captain.
The first year at sea is the toughest. It will get easier - I promise.
He came to me a few days ago, when he heard I spoke Portuguese. We've had a great time conversing ever since. We even had some pastéis de nata the other day.
Did you leave any for me?
I'll take that as a no.
Bauldun, we can chat later. Something is going on in engineering. Report down there after your break.
Remind me again, exactly how many languages do you speak? I'm having some difficulty remembering them all.
Fairly fluently? Quatre. French, English, Portuguese and Dagbani, a beautiful language of Ghana.
I say we use those language skills to our advantage. Hmm... I have an idea. Volta, how would you feel about decoding potentially hostile transmissions?
Ooooh. Perfeito, perfeito, Capitaine.
I'm glad to hear it.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Capitaine, I have two Morganas on our radar.
Everyone, battle stations! Move it, move it!
We have Morgana submarines approaching at a depth of 720 feet. The others appear to be light cruisers...  sneaking up on us.
HEY! WE CAN SEE YOU, YOU SON OF A B...
Volta. Focus.
LET'S GIVE THEM HELL!
HURRAH!
... When in Rome... READY?
READY!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Damn, they move fast... look at them flee.
A few more hits, and they would have been done for. I'm sure of it.
Fire a few last shots. Make sure those Morganas don't have reason to turn around.

Fields.DialogueText: Are you sure we can't catch up with them?
Sorry I couldn't get in a few more rounds, Capitaine.
Roger that.
Report?
We came out of that battle relatively unscathed, I'm proud to say.
Excellent. Great work, Volta.
You too, Capitaine.
Any bites on the line, Volta?
Oceano estúpido...
Oh, for-- Volta, watch where you're throwing that chum.

Fields.MenuText: Are you not getting any bites? You usually haul them into the mess hall by the crate.
It's going to smell like rotten fish for weeks up here.
Come on, Volta. Isn't this part of the sport?

Fields.DialogueText: None. Nenhum. Muyim. Not one of these little suckers are taking the bait. If I can't catch fish, what am I supposed to eat with my champagne?
... I'm sorry, Capitaine. I'll get that cleaned right up. But I was really looking forward to this trawl.
I usually enjoy the waiting game, but I was really craving fresh saltwater fish.
Don't you have some on ice?
I won't be preparing those for quite a while. I'm saving them for a special occasion... I guess I'll have to settle for making something else...
Uh-oh.
Uh-oh? What uh-oh?
I'm picking up a wave heading our way... it's getting bigger as it approaches.
Affirmative. I noticed the wind and waves picking up. Get to your station.
IT'S DISTURBING THE FISH. No wonder I can't get a bite out here!
Right...
@BATTLE
You hear that?
Exactly. Isn't it fantastic?
Mmmmm, yes.
Finally, some R&R.

Fields.MenuText: You're telling me. I don't know the last time I felt the sand beneath my feet.
I... I've lost count on how many drinks I've had. As captain, I'll allow this.
I think I could sleep for weeks...

Fields.DialogueText: There's just something so peaceful about the beach.
I'll drink to that, Capitão. Capitaine. Cappity Cap. Wait... I'm already one step ahead of you.
What a splendid idea. Remind me to add that to my to do list.
I think it's nearly time for a refill. What say you, Volta?
Ii. Oui indeedy! Not only that, but I would absolutely destroy for another dozen oysters. ... Literally.
... Literally?
All right, no. Figuratively.
That's what I thought.
You think I could convince one of the crew members to fetch us...
*ALARM*
What? Not now! C'mon!
@BATTLE
Volta...
I feel it, Capitaine...
How many do you think?
At least a few of them... We can take on some, but the others will easily destroy us...
Our odds aren't looking too good right now... hmm. Hold on.
What are you thinking?

Fields.MenuText: Based on their positions, they're moving to surround us... boost our speed break the incoming wall. We'll attack once we're clear.
Aim artillery at that escort destroyer first. Get rid of their aid, but keep the torpedoes locked onto the main ship.
Hail a support ship in our area. Tell them we need backup fire immediately.

Fields.DialogueText: D'accord. I doubt they've seen a destroyer move this quickly.
Artillery Squad! Aim ordinances towards the escort. Don't let up until they do.
On it.
Get ready...
NOW.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Everyone take a deep breath.
Be ready to fire on my command.
@BATTLE
Volta. How bad is the damage?
... M-merda. Our torpedo tubes are damaged and we're leaking fuel.
If those Morganas on the horizon decide to come after us, we'll be in trouble.
Let's keep moving, put as much distance between us and them as possible. Volta, as much as you're able, save your strength.
I understand.
Captain.
... All right. Looks like you're up, Kim. Man that turret. If those Morganas on the horizon make any moves toward us, I want you ready to fire.
Aye, aye.
You think we'll make it to port, Capitaine?
If anyone can, I think we can.
I think so too.
Did you hear, Capitaine...?
... That Officer Kim died in that last battle? I did.
I can't believe it. He can't be gone.
It does seem... I can't believe it either.
How are you holding up?

Fields.MenuText: You'd think I'd be used to it by now...
Officer Kim knew what he signed up for. But... I can't just say that he was expendable. The damn kid mattered.
It just doesn't seem fair.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sure this is something you ever get used to, Capitaine.
Of course he mattered, and knowing that you care is what makes you a great capitaine.
At least it was quick. He didn't suffer.
There's an old proverb from a country in Africa - "Death is like a dress that, at some point or another, everyone has to wear."
With life, comes death... especially when at war. Don't hold back your sadness, and use that rage to triumph against the enemy. Our time will come.
Thank you... Volta. I'd like a minute alone.
Of course.
@BATTLE
I can't believe this... look at this manifest compared to our allies'.
... What about it? Everything appears to be fine to me.
Some of them received penicillin quicker than we did.

Fields.MenuText: But why is that an issue? We have orders to receive it just like everyone else.
Really, Volta? Is this something to be petty about?
We're lucky enough to get it at all. Supplies get more scarce every day.

Fields.DialogueText: That we do. It just seems like we're always the last to get supplies.
Hmph, It's just...
I understand that, but that's not the point.
What's this all really about?
I understand that we're all fighting on the same side but... it feels as though a few folks don't have our best interests in mind.
Do we need to hold a meeting? Invite an ambassador onboard for a talk?
Eh... maybe. Still, for now, I'd much rather relax and fish. Let's do that.
Me as well?
You're the capitaine, chucklehead. I've already bought you a pole.
Did you just call your captain a chucklehead...? Wait. You bought me a pole? You know that won't get you off the hook.
*ALARM*
A girl can try, can't she?
@BATTLE
Welcome aboard, Ambassador Jaccoud. It's a pleasure to have you.
Indeed, Captain. The pleasure is all mine. Madame Belle, the news tells me you're doing well.
Yes, Ambassador. My research has proven time and again that it pays off. My skills are improving every day.
Agreed. She's been a real help, Ambassador.
Hmm... très bien...
Right this way. We have the best spot on deck reserved just for you. Here you go, Ambassador. Have a seat.
Volta, can I speak with you for a second? Ambassador, please, make yourself comfortable.

Fields.MenuText: What's going on, Volta? You're radiating tension...
You're being awfully nice... what's up?
Are you okay? I can see a vein throbbing in your forehead...

Fields.DialogueText: Is it that obvious? I can't smile any harder...
What do you mean, dear Capitaine? Nothing out of the ordinary here.
I'll show you throbbing.
*ALARM*
Damn, not now...
What's causing that horrid ruckus? I demand to be moved to safety at once.
Yes, Ambassador. Seaman, yes, you. Escort the ambassador below deck.
Coward...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Almost in range...
Good. I have some frustration to work off!
@BATTLE
Did you see the way he pushed past me? And the way he scrunched his beady little nose with every move I made? UGH.
I can understand why he might not be your favorite...
When he leasts expects it, I'll...
Is the fighting over?
Ah! Ambassador. It is, and we won. Of course. Here, we have refreshments this way. I brought up my best vin blanc just for you...

Fields.MenuText: Wait... where did you get that knife? Is that the knife from earlier? What are you going to do with that...?
Volta... you're walking like a lion... and what's with that gleam in your eye?
Volta, wait. Is there some sort of bigger issue here?

Fields.DialogueText: A lady has many hiding spots, Capitaine. Let's just say I'm going to show the ambassador a unique gutting trick.
I wouldn't call it a gleam... More like... a murderous gaze.
Oh my, look at the time. Let the good ambassador part with the wine as a gift, Volta... We have plenty of work to do.
... You're right, Capitaine. Of course. We have strategies to discuss.
Exactly. Volta has formulated a genius strategy for combatting the Morganas.
Ah, really? Well, I wouldn't mind hearing such strategies at some point, Madame.
... Merci, Ambassador. Officer Houston will escort you out.
He could have been worse.
What's on the menu tonight?
NO PEEKING... or I'll boot you out of my hall.
Just a taste. I'll be out of your hair after that.
Fine. Have a small sip of the gravy. A DROP of a taste. Nothing more, or you're gone.
Uh-huh. You *do* remember which one of us is the superior officer, right?
Not in here. I'm the master of this kitchen.
And no wonder. This gravy is... it's so warm. It's the perfect thickness. How do you manage to make such perfect gravy?
Enough silly questions. Hand me the turmeric, would you?

Fields.MenuText: What? You're not going to answer?
Turmeric... turmeric... this one?
You haven't made chicken for a while. Could I put in a request?

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe later... now hand me the turmeric or go.
No, that's cumin. The one I'm pointing to.
... I'll just get the turmeric myself. And if you get too demanding, I'll toss you and the gravy overboard.
Okay chef, how about a quick lesson?
A quick lesson, you say?
Lesson one. Before you touch anything, wash your hands. After touching raw meat, wash your hands. When cutting peppers, wash your hands. After using the latrine, what do you do?
Wash your hands?
Lesson two. When cooking with peppers, keep an eye on the smoke point. Otherwise, you'll have a problem on your hands.
Roger that, Chief Cook Volta. You can handle the peppers for now...
@BATTLE
Come in, Volta. I noticed something had been bothering you...
Are you talking about Ambassador Idiota - I mean Ambassador Jaccoud?
Yes. You want to tell me why you had such a problem with him?
Well...
He got to you, didn't he?
... Oui, Capitaine.
How so?
... I know what I'm capable of. There are things I want to accomplish. But people like him, I feel like they don't take me seriously.
If I don't have the backing of those in authority over me, I fear I won't be able to accomplish those things I want to do.
Just give it time, Volta. You Belles, you're something completely different than what anyone on earth has ever seen.
It will take people time to realize just how valuable you are. But I promise you - it will happen.
Capitaine... thank you. I... thank you.
You're welcome... now. I think it's time we go up deck and catch some fish. Perhaps over bottle of wine?
You know me so well, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Is it just the one?
I think so.
This could be fun!
@BATTLE
What a victory that was! Come on, everyone! I feel like some dancing is in order!
I heard this dance started in New Orleans. What do you think, Bauldun? Can you move the way Volta does?
Not if I'm hoping to walk in the morning. How about you?
I'll give it a try...
I'd advise you not to quit your day job anytime soon, Houston.
Be a bit lighter on your toes, Houston.
Oh, come on, guys. Maybe I just need a glass or two of scotch...
You know, I really do love jazz. I just got a letter from a friend in New Orleans. She's thinking about teaching music once the war's over.
You don't say? I'll have to contact her...
This particular dance really is good exercise. Come on, Capitaine. Dance with me.
All right, all right. How am I doing?
Not too shabby, Capitaine!
In that case, order another round for the whole crew...
Hurrah!
OUI! I am a research genius!
Enter Volta in three... two...
One.
Capitaine! Fantastic news, Capitaine.
News? Just what I was hoping to hear. What's it about?
One word - Torpex.

Fields.MenuText: And...? This is the part where you explain.
Torpex? Well, what does it do?
What is it? Some type of... vortex?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm getting there! Don't rush me.
It's probably going to save us one of these days, I just know it.
HA. Good one, Capitaine.
... Volta.
Right. Sorry. Torpex is short for torpedo explosive. We launch it along with our torpedos, and it creates a bigger explosion, with maximum destructive power.
Or, that's what I hope, anyway. It's based on some explosive gunk I scraped out of a Morgana shell that failed to detonate - but I think that was down to the trigger.
Noted. Just have the torpedo team look it over and give me an all-clear. I'm looking forward to testing this baby out.
*ALARM*
Later?
Yes, later.
@BATTLE
Just out of curiosity, did I know you were scraping gunk out of an unexploded Morgana weapon?
Well... non. But I did most of the work in a kind of makeshift bathysphere under the ship, so it was all perfectly safe.
We have a makeshift bathysphere?
Oui! I'm not sure normal humans would survive in it, but it's great for me. But don't lose sight of the message here, Capitaine: Torpex!
Capitaine. I intercepted a transmission.
It's about time. We've been stuck in a dead zone. What's it about?
They're coordinates. Morgana coordinates. It took me all day to decode them, but now we know where they are.

Fields.MenuText: Get a load of these. It looks as if a number of Morganas are headed northwest...
Looks like there are a few not too far away from us. Nothing to worry about just yet.
We need to get this information out to the other Belles.

Fields.DialogueText: And straight into an ambush. Ha!
Agreed. I'll keep an eye out for anything unusual in the meantime.
One step ahead of you! I sent the word out just minutes ago. We're going to make sure all the Belles are just as prepared as we are.
Wait, look here - what... what's that?
*ALARM*
We have Morganas approaching. I... I have a bad feeling about this...
@BATTLE
Volta, you're shivering, are you cold?
Alaamu...
A... what? That doesn't sound pleasant at all...
An omen... I can feel it in my bones...

Fields.MenuText: How... how can you tell?
Omens? I don't like the talk of omens... but I'm concerned about the way you're chewing at your lip.
What was the omen? I didn't read any reports.

Fields.DialogueText: Everything aches... and don't get me started on the shivers. I couldn't stop them if I tried.
You're telling me. I've been going through ointments like a... I'm not going to finish that sentence.
When I sliced the bread this morning, I found holes in each bread slice... that isn't a good sign.
Now I think I'm getting your shivers... that, and I can barely see out here.
Another omen, Capitaine.
Morganas approaching!
Keep an eye on the mist, Capitaine... it's thickening. I suggest we move. Now.
@BATTLE
Those Morganas, they... they're using our weapons.
They must have captured a crew...
Maybe an ally ship, and took it for everything that it was worth...

Fields.MenuText: Hit them with our mortars.
Torpedos. Launch them.
Aim the bombs towards their engines.

Fields.DialogueText: Launch the mortars with everything you've got!
Torpedos are armed and ready to fire.
Manually aiming bombs!
Merde. That explosion didn't even reach them.
They're fast, that's for sure.
Bruxa...
Update me, how many wounded do we have?
I'm picking up... twelve, Capitaine...
... Dammit. Have whatever medics we have tend to those who need.
I think I have an idea. Remember the Torpex? It... it's not yet ready, but it might be our last chance.
Its impact might stun her long enough for us to finish her off.
At this point, anything is worth trying. We need to do this... do you think it'll work?
Only one way to find out...
Fine then... fire.
@BATTLE
A damn fine day, isn't it?
Agreed. Relaxing on deck, a wine glass in one hand and a fishing pole in the other. I couldn't ask for anything more.
How are you holding up? You took some damage in that last battle.
I'll probably spend more time in my phantom form in the evenings. My sous chef hasn't burned down the kitchen just yet, so I'm enjoying my mandated R&R.

Fields.MenuText: I'm surprised you actually listened.
You're welcome. But I expect you to be back on deck when the time comes.
She's an excellent replacement. I mean... not that you're replaceable.

Fields.DialogueText: You know I just like to tease you.
Ha! I have some new tricks up my sleeve for us to test out. I'm getting excited just thinking about them...
Very funny. You know, you shouldn't mock the one who prepares your food...
Hm... before the fish fall away, how about a little game?
Oh? What kind of game?
Let's see who can catch the most. Fifty francs to the winner.
HA! Capitaine, you're hilarious. Recast your line, and we'll start.

Fields.MenuText: Heh. She doesn't know I have a few tricks up myself as well.
I'll never get over that laugh of hers...
